message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR

This paper is about improving neural machine translation models by encoding rare and unknown words as sequences of subword units. This topic falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP), which is typically classified under cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper discusses the suitability of different word segmentation techniques, which involves machine learning and optimization, and could be classified under cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also involves improving the performance of NMT models, which could be classified under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance of the proposed approach using BLEU scores, which is a common evaluation metric in information retrieval and could be classified under cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
